conclusion: The x-axis represents time in seconds and the y-axis represents velocity in m/s.
The graph shows how the velocity of the particle changes over time.
We are interested in the time interval from t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds.
At t = 2 seconds, the velocity v is 0 m/s.
At t = 3 seconds, the velocity v is -2 m/s.
A positive velocity indicates motion in the positive direction.
A negative velocity indicates motion in the negative direction.
From t = 2 seconds to t = 3 seconds, the velocity is negative (-2 m/s).
Since the velocity is negative during this interval, the particle is moving in the negative direction.
The negative direction is opposite to the defined positive direction.
The motion direction of the particle from 2 to 3 seconds is opposite to the defined positive direction.
